p:
DPPH radical activity was carried out by the Gramza-Michalowska method [ 24]. DPPH is a stable radical, which has a free electron on the nitrogen atom. In the presence of antioxidant DPPH, the color changes from violet to yellow [ 25]. In this test, various concentrations of fractions were added to the methanol solution of DPPH radicals (0.004% m/v). The samples were incubated for 30 minutes at room temperature and the absorbance was recorded at 517 nm against a blank solution. The percent inhibition was calculated using equation ( 2). The inhibitory concentration (IC 50) is determined as the concentration that inhibit 50% of DPPH (I% = 50). The inhibition percentage is calculated using the formula below:
(2)
I % =
A c
–
A s a m p l e
A c
× 100 ,
where Ac is the absorbance of DPPH without antioxidant (negative control) and Asample is the absorbance of DPPH in the presence of an antioxidant.
